2.text: Remove the lid on one side of your contact lens case and set it aside.

3.text: Use your fingertip to slide the contact lens from the case.

4.text: Rinse the contact lens with your contact solution.

5.text: Place the contact concave side up on your index finger.

6.text: Hold your eye open with your middle finger and opposite hand, if necessary.

7.text: Move the contact towards your eye calmly and steadily.

8.text: Place the contact on your iris gently.

9.text: Let go of your eyelids and blink slowly until the contact is comfortable.

10.text: Repeat the process with the other contact.

12.text: Lubricate your eyes with contact-safe eye drops if you have dry eyes.

13.text: Pull your eyelid down with your finger.

14.text: Touch the contact with your index finger and slide it down.

15.text: Squeeze your index finger and thumb around the contact to remove it.

16.text: Put the contact in your palm and clean it.

17.text: Place the contact in its case and add fresh contact solution.

18.text: Repeat the process to take out the other contact.

19.text: Inspect your contact for rips, tears, or debris before putting it on.

20.text: Replace your contacts according to your doctor’s instructions.

21.text: Sleep in your contacts only if your doctor approves it.

22.text: Clean or replace your contact lens case every 3 months.

23.text: Avoid using saliva or tap water to clean your lenses.

24.text: Make sure eye drops are labeled for use with contacts.

25.text: Remove your contacts before you take a bath or shower.

26.text: Avoid swimming or using a hot tub while wearing your contacts.

27.text: Keep a pair of back-up glasses in your current prescription.
